channel.title: CVE Feed for Facebook -- Facebook Thrift
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Facebook -- Facebook Thrift

item.title: CVE-2019-3565|2024-08-04T19:12:09.598Z -- facebook -- facebook%20thrift
item.description: Legacy C++ Facebook Thrift servers (using cpp instead of cpp2) would not error upon receiving messages with containers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.05.06.00.

item.title: CVE-2019-3564|2024-08-04T19:12:09.508Z -- facebook -- facebook%20thrift
item.description: Go Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages with containers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.03.04.00.

item.title: CVE-2019-3559|2024-08-04T19:12:09.476Z -- facebook -- facebook%20thrift
item.description: Java Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages with containers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.02.18.00.

item.title: CVE-2019-3553|2024-08-04T19:12:09.503Z -- facebook -- facebook%20thrift
item.description: C++ Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages declaring containers of sizes larger than the payload. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would result in a large memory allocation, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2020.02.03.00.

item.title: CVE-2019-3552|2024-08-04T19:12:09.356Z -- facebook -- facebook%20thrift
item.description: C++ Facebook Thrift servers (using cpp2) would not error upon receiving messages with containers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.02.18.00.

As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.02.18.00.
